TopicTitle: [1.7-1.9] SMURFF: Simple Module adjUstments for Real-ish Fuel-mass Fractions 1.9.1 (02019 Nov 12)

Articles.Content: To my knowledge, no update is required -- part balance hasn't changed at all for 1.1.3.

This is cool! I've always wanted to have a real-scale game that didn't require me to install a plethora of huge mods. This and Tweakscale would make it pretty easy to do whatever I want in 10x Kerbol!

Be careful with Tweakscale -- because the mass of a part scales with the cube of its length while its thrust (being a function of cross-sectional area) increases by the square, making an engine bigger will actually make its <abbr title="Thrust-to-weight ratio">TWR</abbr> worse.

Hello [@Kerbas_ad_astra](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/126593-kerbas_ad_astra/)

So if I'm using the Half Size <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> mod, I should set the levers to 0.5, correct?

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/142336-113-half-size-rss-v12/&do=embed"></iframe>

Hey thanks very much for making this mod!

So many times I wanted to play Real solar system, but the amount of buggy mods and requirements for 10,000 extra parts mods turned me off of it.

Someone recommended this to me and so glad it exists ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Since you handle other mods resources, can you handle huge range of KSPI-E resources?

While it uses Interstellar Fuel Switch, procedual fuel tank uses MFT patches to adust fuel mass ratios, but there is mismatch.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-06T18:27:47Z" title="07/06/2016 06:27  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 6, 2016</time> by raxo2222**

SMURFF doesn't seem to update the masses of the B9 sabre engines. What would I need to do so it catches these? (They appear to be of type MultiModeEngine, if that helps.)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-07T00:13:57Z" title="07/07/2016 12:13  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 7, 2016</time> by jrandom**

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, raxo2222 said:
> 
> 
> Since you handle other mods resources, can you handle huge range of KSPI-E resources?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> While it uses Interstellar Fuel Switch, procedual fuel tank uses MFT patches to adust fuel mass ratios, but there is mismatch.
> 

My first priority is to support the resources of addons that I use (e.g. Near Future Tech), and second those that are simple to patch (e.g. Procedural Tanks).  KSPI does not fit in either category, and I don't have the time this summer to spend on it.

Additionally, some of its resources (e.g. antimatter) are only produced in the real world in minuscule quantities, and are not "stored" so much as they are held in place for a little while before they decay (never mind transportation), so there's no baseline for me to adjust the tank masses.  Other resources (e.g. various nuclear fuels) are only produced, stored, and transported terrestrially, so their tank mass fractions would be awfully large for spacecraft.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, jrandom said:
> 
> 
> SMURFF doesn't seem to update the masses of the B9 sabre engines. What would I need to do so it catches these?
> 

By design, engine mass buffs only apply to pure (bipropellant) rockets -- SABREs need not apply.  I might revise this when Skylon or some other multi-mode engine works and blows KSP's RAPIER out of the water, but not before.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
>

> 
> 
> By design, engine mass buffs only apply to pure (bipropellant) rockets -- SABREs need not apply.  I might revise this when Skylon or some other multi-mode engine works and blows KSP's RAPIER out of the water, but not before.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

They're cool engines. I am sad now.

*Edit: The B9 SABRE engines model the Skylon engines...*

So you don't have to care about IFS.

But it would be nice to have modular fuel tank patches, so we could have realistic mass ratios for liquid fuel, oxidizer, and monopropellant.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-07T08:19:45Z" title="07/07/2016 08:19  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 7, 2016</time> by raxo2222**

I do not think this mod is working for me. 

I scaled up Kerbin x10 with Sigma Dimensions (also using the New Horizons planet pack, but that doesn't really matter) and installed this mod so I can play it without much hassle.

Normally with the stock size, this rocket I have pictures of here should be easily able to escape Kerbin's <abbr title="Sphere of Influence"><abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr></abbr>. With this mod it should still do the same with the resize. However, even with this mod installed, I only get stock delta V and can not even achieve Low Kerbin Orbit. 

Also I am getting errors on startup, and I suspect that has something to do with it.

hey [@Kerbas_ad_astra](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/126593-kerbas_ad_astra/),

This mod is really fantastic, allowing people to easily swap their solar system for the real one without needing 10,000 mods!

I am really enjoying it and I think so many more people would......if they knew it existed. (I found out about it through reddit)

Can I make two recommendations?

Add this mod to spacedock and or curse so that more people will know it exits and get to enjoy <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> without all the complex installs.

Also see if you can get it mentioned on the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> page. I bet this mod would have so many more players and support if people just knew about it.

thanks, and keep up the great work!

I'll need more information to help you -- your log at a minimum, and Kerbal Engineer's evaluation of your rocket would be good.

As for not being able to make orbit with that rocket, I think it's just not big enough.  SMURFF makes it easier to get into orbit, but not trivial.  The stock Kerbal X can get its upper stage into orbit fully-fueled (and with some left in the core booster's tank as well), but even with SMURFF, an expanded upper stage, and removing the landing gear, it can barely lift the command module into orbit (i.e. no fuel left in the upper stage).  As a rule of thumb, your rocket will need to be about 30 times as massive as whatever you want to lift into space.

As for the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> thread -- it's [@NathanKell](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/75006-nathankell/)'s business to promote whatever mods he sees fit on its <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>, and I'm happy to let him save his thunder for <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> and RP-0 (which have much larger support teams for helping users in trouble).  I know SMURFF gets mentioned by satisfied users in miscellaneous posts on the forums now and then (including the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> thread), which I find a satisfactory amount of advertising.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

(Hipster Kerman thinks getting mentioned on the <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr> would make SMURFF too mainstream: ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:"))

As a modder myself I use both spacedock and curse, and I find spacedock <abbr title="Ferram Aeronautics Research (mod)">FAR</abbr> easier to use than curse. Curse also is seldom supported by the majority of the community these days.

The reason I think you should do this is not for popularity's sake, but because there would probably be a lot of players who would enjoy your mod very much but they have no idea it exits and so they are missing out on your great work.

yeah, I think it's worth adding to the <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>, at the time <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> was the only game in town. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
If that's so, then you're welcome to hang up my shingle.  Thanks!

[@Kerbas_ad_astra](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/126593-kerbas_ad_astra/) Question, where did you get the 1:10 mass ratio for XenonGas. Is this mass ratio achieved in Gas or Liquid/Solid state?

I've seen several references in NASA and SpaceX presentations to 85% or 95% fuel mass fractions, and I found this paper on supercritical storage of xenon and other electric propellants (e.g. argon), which suggests 6.4% as a reasonable tank mass fraction for xenon: [http://erps.spacegrant.org/uploads/images/images/iepc_articledownload_1988-2007/1991index/IEPC1991-107.pdf](http://erps.spacegrant.org/uploads/images/images/iepc_articledownload_1988-2007/1991index/IEPC1991-107.pdf)

First off.. thanks for mod. I like <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> but hate <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>... perfect fit.

Anyone using this i assume is using <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>.. so I have a question for you guys..

What antennas are you using? is there a part pack with longer range antennas?

If you're using RemoteTech, I don't know of any ultra-long-range antennas, but there's a patch in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> (contributed by yours truly) that will automatically extend the ranges of all antennas for AntennaRange.  (You could probably make something similar for RT -- it's just a multiplication by ten.)

I understand that <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> also comes with the Deep Space Network; if you set RangeModelType = Root, then an ultra-long-range ground station can allow even a relatively weak space antenna to complete the connection.

[@Kerbas_ad_astra](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/126593-kerbas_ad_astra/),

Thanks for the great mod!! I am using it for my <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> playthrough, but it has 5 errors on loading. I looked at them and it has to do with this relevant code pulled from the log:

    [ModuleManager] Applying node SMURFF/SMURFF/@PART[*]:HAS[@RESOURCE[Ore],~SMURFFExclude[*rue]]:FOR[zzz_SMURFF] to ProceduralParts/Parts/Tanks/TankOre/proceduralTankOre

    (Filename: C:/buildslave/unity/build/artifacts/generated/common/runtime/UnityEngineDebugBindings.gen.cpp Line: 64)

    (Filename: C:/buildslave/unity/build/artifacts/generated/common/runtime/UnityEngineDebugBindings.gen.cpp Line: 64)

Looks like it is an issue with the Procedural Ore Tank possibly?

I had the same issue - might be due to some mod interactions (I saw in <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> install as well) as I thought it was addressed earlier -

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/117992-1123-smurff-simple-module-adjustments-for-real-ish-fuel-mass-fractions-153-2015-may-28/&do=embed&embedComment=2605201&embedDo=findComment&page=7#comment-2605201"></iframe>

You can delete the procedural ore tank part by deleting cfg.

> 
> 
> 19 hours ago, Kerbas\_ad\_astra said:
> 
> 
> [@pap1723](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/148945-pap1723/), could you please try this patch?  If it works, I'll add it to the "Extras" folder in the next release (same as the patches for the cryogenic tanks in Ven's Stock Revamp).
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     @PART[proceduralTankOre]:FIRST
>     {@RESOURCE[Ore]{	%amount = 171.4	%maxAmount = 171.4}
>     }
>

You're welcome!

**[Version 1.5.4](https://github.com/Kerbas-ad-astra/SMURFF/releases/tag/v1.5.4)** "Tanks F-Ore Nothing" is out!

- Added an "Extra" patch to fix the procedural ore tank. If you're using Procedural Parts, drop the "ProcOreFixer.cfg" patch in your GameData folder (anywhere will do).
- The license is changed to the GPL v3 (or later).
